newTodos.content: Create emoji encoding map for Manus knowledge compression
Implement security configuration and auth middleware
Build rate limiting and monitoring system
Create API gateway with endpoint implementations

input.content:
security:
  # Core Security Configuration
  encryption:
    algorithm: AES-256-GCM
    key_rotation_days: 30
    tls_version: "1.3"
    cipher_suites:
      - TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
      - TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
      - TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

  # Authentication Configuration
  authentication:
    jwt:
      algorithm: RS256
      issuer: "https://auth.autonogrammer.ai"
      audience: "https://api.autonogrammer.ai"
      expiry_seconds: 3600
      refresh_expiry_seconds: 604800
      key_store: "vault://jwt-keys"
      
    api_keys:
      header_name: "X-API-Key"
      min_length: 32
      rotation_policy: "quarterly"
      hash_algorithm: "bcrypt"
      cost_factor: 12
      
    oauth2:
      providers:
        - name: "internal"
          authorization_url: "https://auth.autonogrammer.ai/oauth/authorize"
          token_url: "https://auth.autonogrammer.ai/oauth/token"
          client_validation: true
          pkce_required: true
          
    multi_factor:
      enabled: true
      methods:
        - totp
        - webauthn
        - sms
      grace_period_seconds: 300

  # Authorization Configuration
  authorization:
    rbac:
      enabled: true
      roles:
        - name: "admin"
          permissions:
            - "*:*"
        - name: "enterprise"
          permissions:
            - "quantum:*"
            - "enterprise:*"
            - "context:*"
            - "knowledge:*"
            - "workflow:*"
            - "analytics:read"
        - name: "pro"
          permissions:
            - "quantum:process"
            - "enterprise:solve"
            - "context:optimize"
            - "knowledge:query"
            - "analytics:read"
        - name: "basic"
          permissions:
            - "context:optimize"
            - "knowledge:query"
            
    abac:
      enabled: true
      policies:
        - name: "data_residency"
          condition: "resource.region == user.region"
        - name: "time_based_access"
          condition: "current_time >= user.access_start && current_time <= user.access_end"
        - name: "ip_whitelist"
          condition: "request.ip in user.allowed_ips"

  # Rate Limiting Configuration
  rate_limiting:
    enabled: true
    storage: "redis"
    algorithm: "sliding_window"
    tiers:
      basic:
        requests_per_hour: 100
        burst_size: 20
        concurrent_requests: 5
      pro:
        requests_per_hour: 1000
        burst_size: 100
        concurrent_requests: 20
      enterprise:
        requests_per_hour: 10000
        burst_size: 500
        concurrent_requests: 100
      unlimited:
        requests_per_hour: -1
        burst_size: -1
        concurrent_requests: -1
    
    endpoint_overrides:
      "/quantum/process":
        multiplier: 10  # Costs 10x normal requests
      "/security/audit":
        multiplier: 5   # Costs 5x normal requests
      "/health":
        multiplier: 0   # Free endpoint

  # Security Headers
  headers:
    X-Content-Type-Options: "nosniff"
    X-Frame-Options: "DENY"
    X-XSS-Protection: "1; mode=block"
    Strict-Transport-Security: "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload"
    Content-Security-Policy: "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'"
    Referrer-Policy: "strict-origin-when-cross-origin"
    Permissions-Policy: "geolocation=(), microphone=(), camera=()"

  # CORS Configuration
  cors:
    enabled: true
    allowed_origins:
      - "https://autonogrammer.ai"
      - "https://*.autonogrammer.ai"
    allowed_methods:
      - GET
      - POST
      - PUT
      - DELETE
      - OPTIONS
    allowed_headers:
      - Authorization
      - Content-Type
      - X-API-Key
      - X-Request-ID
    exposed_headers:
      - X-RateLimit-Limit
      - X-RateLimit-Remaining
      - X-RateLimit-Reset
      - X-Trace-Id
    max_age_seconds: 86400
    allow_credentials: true

  # Input Validation
  validation:
    max_request_size_mb: 10
    max_json_depth: 10
    sanitization:
      enabled: true
      strip_html: true
      escape_special_chars: true
    schema_validation:
      enabled: true
      strict_mode: true
      additional_properties: false

  # Audit Logging
  audit:
    enabled: true
    storage: "elasticsearch"
    retention_days: 365
    log_level: "info"
    events:
      - authentication_success
      - authentication_failure
      - authorization_failure
      - rate_limit_exceeded
      - suspicious_activity
      - data_access
      - configuration_change
      - security_event
    
    sensitive_data_masking:
      enabled: true
      fields:
        - password
        - api_key
        - token
        - secret
        - ssn
        - credit_card

  # Threat Detection
  threat_detection:
    enabled: true
    providers:
      - name: "anomaly_detection"
        algorithm: "isolation_forest"
        threshold: 0.95
      - name: "pattern_matching"
        rules_source: "owasp_top_10"
      - name: "ml_based"
        model: "quantum_threat_detector_v2"
    
    actions:
      low_risk:
        - log
        - monitor
      medium_risk:
        - log
        - alert
        - rate_limit_reduce
      high_risk:
        - log
        - alert
        - block
        - notify_security_team

  # DDoS Protection
  ddos_protection:
    enabled: true
    provider: "cloudflare"
    sensitivity: "high"
    challenge_threshold: 100
    block_threshold: 1000
    
  # WAF Configuration
  waf:
    enabled: true
    provider: "modsecurity"
    ruleset: "owasp_crs_3.3"
    paranoia_level: 2
    anomaly_threshold: 5
    custom_rules:
      - rule: "SecRule REQUEST_URI \"@contains /admin\" \"id:1001,phase:1,deny,status:403,msg:'Admin access attempted'\""

  # Secrets Management
  secrets:
    provider: "hashicorp_vault"
    endpoint: "https://vault.autonogrammer.ai"
    namespace: "api"
    auto_rotation: true
    rotation_interval_days: 90

  # Compliance
  compliance:
    frameworks:
      - GDPR
      - SOC2
      - HIPAA
      - PCI-DSS
      - ISO27001
    
    data_protection:
      encryption_at_rest: true
      encryption_in_transit: true
      data_anonymization: true
      right_to_be_forgotten: true
      data_portability: true
    
    audit_requirements:
      quarterly_review: true
      penetration_testing: true
      vulnerability_scanning: true
      compliance_reporting: true

  # Incident Response
  incident_response:
    enabled: true
    contact_email: "security@autonogrammer.ai"
    escalation_levels:
      - level: 1
        response_time_minutes: 15
        contacts: ["oncall@autonogrammer.ai"]
      - level: 2
        response_time_minutes: 5
        contacts: ["security-team@autonogrammer.ai"]
      - level: 3
        response_time_minutes: 1
        contacts: ["ciso@autonogrammer.ai", "cto@autonogrammer.ai"]
    
    playbooks:
      - name: "data_breach"
        steps:
          - isolate_affected_systems
          - preserve_evidence
          - notify_legal
          - notify_affected_users
          - conduct_forensics
          - implement_fixes
          - post_incident_review

  # Zero Trust Configuration
  zero_trust:
    enabled: true
    verify_every_request: true
    assume_breach: true
    least_privilege: true
    microsegmentation: true
    continuous_verification: true

content.text: Now let me create the authentication middleware implementation:

input.content:
"""
Authentication Middleware for Autonogrammer AI Platform
Implements JWT, API Key, and OAuth2 authentication with comprehensive security features
"""

import os
import time
import hmac
import hashlib
import secrets
from typing import Optional, Dict, Any, List, Tuple
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from functools import wraps
from dataclasses import dataclass
import jwt
import bcrypt
import redis
from cryptography.fernet import Fernet
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives import hashes
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.kdf.pbkdf2 import PBKDF2


@dataclass
class AuthToken:
    """Authentication token data structure"""
    token_type: str  # jwt, api_key, oauth2
    user_id: str
    roles: List[str]
    permissions: List[str]
    tier: str  # basic, pro, enterprise, unlimited
    expires_at: datetime
    metadata: Dict[str, Any]


class SecurityManager:
    """Core security manager for the API platform"""
    
    def __init__(self, config_path: str = "security-config.yaml"):
        self.config = self._load_config(config_path)
        self.redis_client = redis.Redis(
            host=os.getenv("REDIS_HOST", "localhost"),
            port=int(os.getenv("REDIS_PORT", 6379)),
            decode_responses=True
        )
        self.encryption_key = self._generate_encryption_key()
        self.fernet = Fernet(self.encryption_key)
        
    def _load_config(self, config_path: str) -> Dict:
        """Load security configuration from YAML file"""
        import yaml
        with open(config_path, 'r') as f:
            return yaml.safe_load(f)
    
    def _generate_encryption_key(self) -> bytes:
        """Generate or retrieve encryption key from secure storage"""
        # In production, retrieve from HashiCorp Vault or AWS KMS
        password = os.getenv("ENCRYPTION_PASSWORD", "default-dev-password").encode()
        kdf = PBKDF2(
            algorithm=hashes.SHA256(),
            length=32,
            salt=b'stable-salt',  # In production, use random salt stored securely
            iterations=100000,
        )
        import base64
        return base64.urlsafe_b64encode(kdf.derive(password))


class JWTAuthenticator:
    """JWT-based authentication handler"""
    
    def __init__(self, security_manager: SecurityManager):
        self.security = security_manager
        self.algorithm = "RS256"
        self.issuer = "https://auth.autonogrammer.ai"
        self.audience = "https://api.autonogrammer.ai"
        self.private_key = self._load_private_key()
        self.public_key = self._load_public_key()
    
    def _load_private_key(self) -> str:
        """Load RSA private key for JWT signing"""
        # In production, load from secure key management service
        return """-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEpAIBAAKCAQEA0Z3VS0JJcds...
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"""
    
    def _load_public_key(self) -> str:
        """Load RSA public key for JWT verification"""
        return """-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----
MIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8A...
-----END PUBLIC KEY-----"""
    
    def generate_token(self, user_id: str, roles: List[str], 
                      permissions: List[str], tier: str) -> Tuple[str, str]:
        """Generate JWT access and refresh tokens"""
        now = datetime.utcnow()
        
        # Access token payload
        access_payload = {
            "sub": user_id,
            "iss": self.issuer,
            "aud": self.audience,
            "exp": now + timedelta(hours=1),
            "iat": now,
            "nbf": now,
            "jti": secrets.token_urlsafe(16),
            "roles": roles,
            "permissions": permissions,
            "tier": tier,
            "quantum_enabled": tier in ["enterprise", "unlimited"]
        }
        
        # Refresh token payload
        refresh_payload = {
            "sub": user_id,
            "iss": self.issuer,
            "aud": self.audience,
            "exp": now + timedelta(days=7),
            "iat": now,
            "jti": secrets.token_urlsafe(16),
            "type": "refresh"
        }
        
        access_token = jwt.encode(access_payload, self.private_key, algorithm=self.algorithm)
        refresh_token = jwt.encode(refresh_payload, self.private_key, algorithm=self.algorithm)
        
        # Store tokens in Redis for tracking and revocation
        self.security.redis_client.setex(
            f"token:{access_payload['jti']}", 
            3600, 
            user_id
        )
        self.security.redis_client.setex(
            f"refresh:{refresh_payload['jti']}", 
            604800, 
            user_id
        )
        
        return access_token, refresh_token
    
    def verify_token(self, token: str) -> Optional[AuthToken]:
        """Verify and decode JWT token"""
        try:
            payload = jwt.decode(
                token,
                self.public_key,
                algorithms=[self.algorithm],
                audience=self.audience,
                issuer=self.issuer
            )
            
            # Check if token is revoked
            if not self.security.redis_client.exists(f"token:{payload['jti']}"):
                return None
            
            return AuthToken(
                token_type="jwt",
                user_id=payload["sub"],
                roles=payload.get("roles", []),
                permissions=payload.get("permissions", []),
                tier=payload.get("tier", "basic"),
                expires_at=datetime.fromtimestamp(payload["exp"]),
                metadata={"jti": payload["jti"], "quantum_enabled": payload.get("quantum_enabled", False)}
            )
            
        except jwt.ExpiredSignatureError:
            return None
        except jwt.InvalidTokenError:
            return None
    
    def revoke_token(self, jti: str):
        """Revoke a token by removing it from Redis"""
        self.security.redis_client.delete(f"token:{jti}")
        self.security.redis_client.delete(f"refresh:{jti}")


class APIKeyAuthenticator:
    """API Key-based authentication handler"""
    
    def __init__(self, security_manager: SecurityManager):
        self.security = security_manager
        self.min_length = 32
        self.hash_rounds = 12
    
    def generate_api_key(self, user_id: str, tier: str, 
                        permissions: List[str]) -> str:
        """Generate a new API key"""
        # Generate cryptographically secure random key
        api_key = secrets.token_urlsafe(48)
        
        # Hash the key for storage
        hashed = bcrypt.hashpw(api_key.encode(), bcrypt.gensalt(self.hash_rounds))
        
        # Store key metadata in database
        key_metadata = {
            "user_id": user_id,
            "tier": tier,
            "permissions": permissions,
            "created_at": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
            "last_used": None,
            "usage_count": 0
        }
        
        # Store in Redis with encrypted metadata
        encrypted_metadata = self.security.fernet.encrypt(
            str(key_metadata).encode()
        )
        self.security.redis_client.hset(
            "api_keys",
            hashed.decode(),
            encrypted_metadata.decode()
        )
        
        return api_key
    
    def verify_api_key(self, api_key: str) -> Optional[AuthToken]:
        """Verify an API key"""
        if len(api_key) < self.min_length:
            return None
        
        # Check all stored hashed keys
        all_keys = self.security.redis_client.hgetall("api_keys")
        
        for hashed_key, encrypted_metadata in all_keys.items():
            if bcrypt.checkpw(api_key.encode(), hashed_key.encode()):
                # Decrypt and parse metadata
                decrypted = self.security.fernet.decrypt(encrypted_metadata.encode())
                metadata = eval(decrypted.decode())  # In production, use json.loads
                
                # Update usage statistics
                metadata["last_used"] = datetime.utcnow().isoformat()
                metadata["usage_count"] += 1
                
                # Re-encrypt and store updated metadata
                encrypted_metadata = self.security.fernet.encrypt(
                    str(metadata).encode()
                )
                self.security.redis_client.hset(
                    "api_keys",
                    hashed_key,
                    encrypted_metadata.decode()
                )
                
                return AuthToken(
                    token_type="api_key",
                    user_id=metadata["user_id"],
                    roles=["api_user"],
                    permissions=metadata["permissions"],
                    tier=metadata["tier"],
                    expires_at=datetime.max,  # API keys don't expire
                    metadata=metadata
                )
        
        return None
    
    def revoke_api_key(self, api_key: str):
        """Revoke an API key"""
        all_keys = self.security.redis_client.hgetall("api_keys")
        
        for hashed_key in all_keys.keys():

class OAuth2Authenticator:
    """OAuth2-based authentication handler"""
    
    def __init__(self, security_manager: SecurityManager):
        self.security = security_manager
        self.providers = {}
        self._initialize_providers()
    
    def _initialize_providers(self):
        """Initialize OAuth2 providers from configuration"""
        oauth_config = self.security.config["security"]["authentication"]["oauth2"]
        for provider in oauth_config["providers"]:
            self.providers[provider["name"]] = provider
    
    def generate_authorization_url(self, provider: str, client_id: str, 
                                  redirect_uri: str, state: str) -> str:
        """Generate OAuth2 authorization URL"""
        if provider not in self.providers:
            raise ValueError(f"Unknown OAuth2 provider: {provider}")
        
        provider_config = self.providers[provider]
        params = {
            "client_id": client_id,
            "redirect_uri": redirect_uri,
            "response_type": "code",
            "state": state,
            "scope": "read write"
        }

            params["code_challenge_method"] = "S256"

            self.security.redis_client.setex(

        if provider not in self.providers:

        # Prepare token request
        token_data = {
            "grant_type": "authorization_code",
            "code": code,
            "client_id": client_id,
            "client_secret": client_secret,
            "redirect_uri": redirect_uri
        }
        
        # Add PKCE verifier if required
        if provider_config.get("pkce_required"):
            code_verifier = self.security.redis_client.get(f"pkce:{state}")
            if not code_verifier:

            token_data["code_verifier"] = code_verifier
            self.security.redis_client.delete(f"pkce:{state}")
        
        # Make token request (simplified for example)
        # In production, use requests library with proper error handling
        import requests
        response = requests.post(
            provider_config["token_url"],

        )
        
        if response.status_code != 200:

        token_response = response.json()
        
        # Decode and validate the token

        return AuthToken(
            token_type="oauth2",
            user_id=token_response.get("sub", "oauth_user"),
            roles=["oauth_user"],
            permissions=token_response.get("scope", "").split(),

            expires_at=datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(seconds=token_response.get("expires_in", 3600)),
            metadata={"provider": provider, "access_token": token_response["access_token"]}
        )


class AuthenticationMiddleware:
    """Main authentication middleware for the API"""
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.security = SecurityManager()
        self.jwt_auth = JWTAuthenticator(self.security)
        self.api_key_auth = APIKeyAuthenticator(self.security)
        self.oauth2_auth = OAuth2Authenticator(self.security)
        
    def authenticate(self, request) -> Optional[AuthToken]:
        """Authenticate a request using available methods"""
        
        # Check for Bearer token (JWT)
        auth_header = request.headers.get("Authorization", "")
        if auth_header.startswith("Bearer "):
            token = auth_header[7:]
            auth_token = self.jwt_auth.verify_token(token)
            if auth_token:
                return auth_token
        
        # Check for API Key
        api_key = request.headers.get("X-API-Key")
        if api_key:
            auth_token = self.api_key_auth.verify_api_key(api_key)
            if auth_token:
                return auth_token
        
        # Check for OAuth2 token
        if auth_header.startswith("OAuth "):
            # Simplified OAuth token verification
            # In production, validate with OAuth provider
            pass
        
        return None
    
    def authorize(self, auth_token: AuthToken, required_permission: str) -> bool:
        """Check if authenticated user has required permission"""
        if not auth_token:
            return False
        
        # Admin has all permissions
        if "admin" in auth_token.roles:
            return True
        
        # Check specific permission
        if required_permission in auth_token.permissions:
            return True
        
        # Check wildcard permissions
        resource, action = required_permission.split(":")
        if f"{resource}:*" in auth_token.permissions:
            return True
        if "*:*" in auth_token.permissions:
            return True
        
        return False
    
    def enforce_rate_limit(self, auth_token: AuthToken, endpoint: str) -> bool:
        """Enforce rate limiting based on user tier"""
        if not auth_token:
            return False
        
        tier_config = self.security.config["security"]["rate_limiting"]["tiers"][auth_token.tier]
        
        if tier_config["requests_per_hour"] == -1:
            return True  # Unlimited tier
        
        # Check endpoint multiplier
        endpoint_config = self.security.config["security"]["rate_limiting"].get("endpoint_overrides", {})
        multiplier = endpoint_config.get(endpoint, {}).get("multiplier", 1)
        
        # Calculate rate limit key
        window = datetime.utcnow().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H")
        rate_key = f"rate:{auth_token.user_id}:{window}"
        
        # Get current count
        current = self.security.redis_client.get(rate_key)
        current_count = int(current) if current else 0
        
        # Apply multiplier to request count
        request_cost = multiplier if multiplier > 0 else 0
        
        if current_count + request_cost > tier_config["requests_per_hour"]:
            return False
        
        # Increment counter
        if request_cost > 0:
            self.security.redis_client.incrby(rate_key, request_cost)
            self.security.redis_client.expire(rate_key, 3600)
        
        return True


def require_auth(permission: str = None):
    """Decorator for protecting API endpoints"""
    def decorator(func):
        @wraps(func)
        def wrapper(request, *args, **kwargs):
            middleware = AuthenticationMiddleware()
            
            # Authenticate
            auth_token = middleware.authenticate(request)
            if not auth_token:
                return {"error": "Authentication required"}, 401
            
            # Authorize
            if permission and not middleware.authorize(auth_token, permission):
                return {"error": "Insufficient permissions"}, 403
            
            # Rate limit
            endpoint = request.path
            if not middleware.enforce_rate_limit(auth_token, endpoint):
                return {"error": "Rate limit exceeded"}, 429
            
            # Add auth context to request
            request.auth = auth_token
            
            return func(request, *args, **kwargs)
        return wrapper
    return decorator

"""
Authentication Middleware for Autonogrammer AI Platform
Implements JWT, API Key, and OAuth2 authentication with comprehensive security features
"""

import os
import time
import hmac
import hashlib
import secrets
from typing import Optional, Dict, Any, List, Tuple
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from functools import wraps
from dataclasses import dataclass
import jwt
import bcrypt
import redis
from cryptography.fernet import Fernet
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives import hashes
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.kdf.pbkdf2 import PBKDF2


@dataclass
class AuthToken:
    """Authentication token data structure"""
    token_type: str  # jwt, api_key, oauth2
    user_id: str
    roles: List[str]
    permissions: List[str]
    tier: str  # basic, pro, enterprise, unlimited
    expires_at: datetime
    metadata: Dict[str, Any]


class SecurityManager:
    """Core security manager for the API platform"""
    
    def __init__(self, config_path: str = "security-config.yaml"):
        self.config = self._load_config(config_path)
        self.redis_client = redis.Redis(
            host=os.getenv("REDIS_HOST", "localhost"),
            port=int(os.getenv("REDIS_PORT", 6379)),
            decode_responses=True
        )
        self.encryption_key = self._generate_encryption_key()
        self.fernet = Fernet(self.encryption_key)
        
    def _load_config(self, config_path: str) -> Dict:
        """Load security configuration from YAML file"""
        import yaml
        with open(config_path, 'r') as f:
            return yaml.safe_load(f)
    
    def _generate_encryption_key(self) -> bytes:
        """Generate or retrieve encryption key from secure storage"""
        # In production, retrieve from HashiCorp Vault or AWS KMS
        password = os.getenv("ENCRYPTION_PASSWORD", "default-dev-password").encode()
        kdf = PBKDF2(
            algorithm=hashes.SHA256(),
            length=32,
            salt=b'stable-salt',  # In production, use random salt stored securely
            iterations=100000,
        )
        import base64
        return base64.urlsafe_b64encode(kdf.derive(password))


class JWTAuthenticator:
    """JWT-based authentication handler"""
    
    def __init__(self, security_manager: SecurityManager):
        self.security = security_manager
        self.algorithm = "RS256"
        self.issuer = "https://auth.autonogrammer.ai"
        self.audience = "https://api.autonogrammer.ai"
        self.private_key = self._load_private_key()
        self.public_key = self._load_public_key()
    
    def _load_private_key(self) -> str:
        """Load RSA private key for JWT signing"""
        # In production, load from secure key management service
        return """-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEpAIBAAKCAQEA0Z3VS0JJcds...
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----"""
    
    def _load_public_key(self) -> str:
        """Load RSA public key for JWT verification"""
        return """-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----
MIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8A...
-----END PUBLIC KEY-----"""
    
    def generate_token(self, user_id: str, roles: List[str], 
                      permissions: List[str], tier: str) -> Tuple[str, str]:
        """Generate JWT access and refresh tokens"""
        now = datetime.utcnow()
        
        # Access token payload
        access_payload = {
            "sub": user_id,
            "iss": self.issuer,
            "aud": self.audience,
            "exp": now + timedelta(hours=1),
            "iat": now,
            "nbf": now,
            "jti": secrets.token_urlsafe(16),
            "roles": roles,
            "permissions": permissions,
            "tier": tier,
            "quantum_enabled": tier in ["enterprise", "unlimited"]
        }
        
        # Refresh token payload
        refresh_payload = {
            "sub": user_id,
            "iss": self.issuer,
            "aud": self.audience,
            "exp": now + timedelta(days=7),
            "iat": now,
            "jti": secrets.token_urlsafe(16),
            "type": "refresh"
        }
        
        access_token = jwt.encode(access_payload, self.private_key, algorithm=self.algorithm)
        refresh_token = jwt.encode(refresh_payload, self.private_key, algorithm=self.algorithm)
        
        # Store tokens in Redis for tracking and revocation
        self.security.redis_client.setex(
            f"token:{access_payload['jti']}", 
            3600, 
            user_id
        )
        self.security.redis_client.setex(
            f"refresh:{refresh_payload['jti']}", 
            604800, 
            user_id
        )
        
        return access_token, refresh_token
    
    def verify_token(self, token: str) -> Optional[AuthToken]:
        """Verify and decode JWT token"""
        try:
            payload = jwt.decode(
                token,
                self.public_key,
                algorithms=[self.algorithm],
                audience=self.audience,
                issuer=self.issuer
            )
            
            # Check if token is revoked
            if not self.security.redis_client.exists(f"token:{payload['jti']}"):
                return None
            
            return AuthToken(
                token_type="jwt",
                user_id=payload["sub"],
                roles=payload.get("roles", []),
                permissions=payload.get("permissions", []),
                tier=payload.get("tier", "basic"),
                expires_at=datetime.fromtimestamp(payload["exp"]),
                metadata={"jti": payload["jti"], "quantum_enabled": payload.get("quantum_enabled", False)}
            )
            
        except jwt.ExpiredSignatureError:
            return None
        except jwt.InvalidTokenError:
            return None
    
    def revoke_token(self, jti: str):
        """Revoke a token by removing it from Redis"""
        self.security.redis_client.delete(f"token:{jti}")
        self.security.redis_client.delete(f"refresh:{jti}")


class APIKeyAuthenticator:
    """API Key-based authentication handler"""
    
    def __init__(self, security_manager: SecurityManager):
        self.security = security_manager
        self.min_length = 32
        self.hash_rounds = 12
    
    def generate_api_key(self, user_id: str, tier: str, 
                        permissions: List[str]) -> str:
        """Generate a new API key"""
        # Generate cryptographically secure random key
        api_key = secrets.token_urlsafe(48)
        
        # Hash the key for storage
        hashed = bcrypt.hashpw(api_key.encode(), bcrypt.gensalt(self.hash_rounds))
        
        # Store key metadata in database
        key_metadata = {
            "user_id": user_id,
            "tier": tier,
            "permissions": permissions,
            "created_at": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
            "last_used": None,
            "usage_count": 0
        }
        
        # Store in Redis with encrypted metadata
        encrypted_metadata = self.security.fernet.encrypt(
            str(key_metadata).encode()
        )
        self.security.redis_client.hset(
            "api_keys",
            hashed.decode(),
            encrypted_metadata.decode()
        )
        
        return api_key
    
    def verify_api_key(self, api_key: str) -> Optional[AuthToken]:
        """Verify an API key"""
        if len(api_key) < self.min_length:
            return None
        
        # Check all stored hashed keys
        all_keys = self.security.redis_client.hgetall("api_keys")
        
        for hashed_key, encrypted_metadata in all_keys.items():
            if bcrypt.checkpw(api_key.encode(), hashed_key.encode()):
                # Decrypt and parse metadata
                decrypted = self.security.fernet.decrypt(encrypted_metadata.encode())
                metadata = eval(decrypted.decode())  # In production, use json.loads
                
                # Update usage statistics
                metadata["last_used"] = datetime.utcnow().isoformat()
                metadata["usage_count"] += 1
                
                # Re-encrypt and store updated metadata
                encrypted_metadata = self.security.fernet.encrypt(
                    str(metadata).encode()
                )
                self.security.redis_client.hset(
                    "api_keys",
                    hashed_key,
                    encrypted_metadata.decode()
                )
                
                return AuthToken(
                    token_type="api_key",
                    user_id=metadata["user_id"],
                    roles=["api_user"],
                    permissions=metadata["permissions"],
                    tier=metadata["tier"],
                    expires_at=datetime.max,  # API keys don't expire
                    metadata=metadata
                )
        
        return None
    
    def revoke_api_key(self, api_key: str):
        """Revoke an API key"""
        all_keys = self.security.redis_client.hgetall("api_keys")
        
        for hashed_key in all_keys.keys():
            if bcrypt.checkpw(api_key.encode(), hashed_key.encode()):
                self.security.redis_client.hdel("api_keys", hashed_key)
                break

"""
Advanced Rate Limiting and Monitoring System for Autonogrammer AI Platform
Implements sliding window rate limiting with burst protection and real-time monitoring
"""

import os
import time
import json
import asyncio
import hashlib
from typing import Dict, Optional, List, Tuple, Any
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from dataclasses import dataclass, asdict
from collections import deque, defaultdict
from enum import Enum
import redis
import prometheus_client as prom
from threading import Lock
import numpy as np


class RateLimitAlgorithm(Enum):
    """Supported rate limiting algorithms"""
    FIXED_WINDOW = "fixed_window"
    SLIDING_WINDOW = "sliding_window"
    TOKEN_BUCKET = "token_bucket"
    LEAKY_BUCKET = "leaky_bucket"
    ADAPTIVE = "adaptive"


@dataclass
class RateLimitConfig:
    """Rate limit configuration for a tier"""
    tier: str
    requests_per_hour: int
    burst_size: int
    concurrent_requests: int
    algorithm: RateLimitAlgorithm = RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW
    adaptive_threshold: float = 0.8  # Trigger adaptive limiting at 80% usage


@dataclass
class RateLimitStatus:
    """Current rate limit status for a user"""
    allowed: bool
    limit: int
    remaining: int
    reset_at: datetime
    retry_after: Optional[int]  # Seconds until retry
    tier: str
    current_usage: float  # Percentage of limit used


class RateLimitMetrics:
    """Prometheus metrics for rate limiting"""
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.requests_total = prom.Counter(
            'rate_limit_requests_total',
            'Total number of rate limit checks',
            ['tier', 'endpoint', 'result']
        )
        self.requests_remaining = prom.Gauge(
            'rate_limit_requests_remaining',
            'Remaining requests in current window',
            ['user_id', 'tier']
        )
        self.limit_exceeded = prom.Counter(
            'rate_limit_exceeded_total',
            'Number of rate limit exceeded events',
            ['tier', 'endpoint']
        )
        self.response_time = prom.Histogram(
            'rate_limit_check_duration_seconds',
            'Time taken to check rate limit',
            buckets=[0.001, 0.005, 0.01, 0.025, 0.05, 0.1]
        )


class SlidingWindowRateLimiter:
    """Sliding window rate limiter implementation"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_client: redis.Redis, config: RateLimitConfig):
        self.redis = redis_client
        self.config = config
        self.window_size = 3600  # 1 hour in seconds
        
    def check(self, user_id: str, endpoint: str, cost: int = 1) -> Tuple[bool, int]:
        """Check if request is allowed under sliding window"""
        now = time.time()
        window_start = now - self.window_size
        
        # Redis key for user's request timestamps
        key = f"sliding:{user_id}:{endpoint}"
        
        # Remove old entries outside the window
        self.redis.zremrangebyscore(key, 0, window_start)
        
        # Count requests in current window
        current_count = self.redis.zcard(key)
        
        # Check if limit would be exceeded
        if current_count + cost > self.config.requests_per_hour:
            return False, current_count
        
        # Add current request timestamp with unique ID to handle concurrent requests
        unique_id = f"{now}:{hashlib.md5(f'{user_id}{endpoint}{now}'.encode()).hexdigest()[:8]}"
        self.redis.zadd(key, {unique_id: now})
        
        # Set expiry on the key
        self.redis.expire(key, self.window_size)
        
        return True, self.config.requests_per_hour - current_count - cost


class TokenBucketRateLimiter:
    """Token bucket rate limiter implementation"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_client: redis.Redis, config: RateLimitConfig):
        self.redis = redis_client
        self.config = config
        self.refill_rate = config.requests_per_hour / 3600  # Tokens per second
        
    def check(self, user_id: str, endpoint: str, cost: int = 1) -> Tuple[bool, int]:
        """Check if request is allowed under token bucket"""
        key = f"bucket:{user_id}:{endpoint}"
        now = time.time()
        
        # Get current bucket state
        bucket_data = self.redis.hgetall(key)
        
        if not bucket_data:
            # Initialize bucket
            tokens = self.config.burst_size
            last_refill = now
        else:
            tokens = float(bucket_data.get('tokens', self.config.burst_size))
            last_refill = float(bucket_data.get('last_refill', now))
        
        # Calculate tokens to add based on time elapsed
        elapsed = now - last_refill
        tokens_to_add = elapsed * self.refill_rate
        tokens = min(tokens + tokens_to_add, self.config.burst_size)
        
        # Check if enough tokens available
        if tokens < cost:
            # Update bucket state even on failure
            self.redis.hset(key, mapping={
                'tokens': tokens,
                'last_refill': now
            })
            self.redis.expire(key, 3600)
            return False, int(tokens)
        
        # Consume tokens
        tokens -= cost
        self.redis.hset(key, mapping={
            'tokens': tokens,
            'last_refill': now
        })
        self.redis.expire(key, 3600)
        
        return True, int(tokens)


class AdaptiveRateLimiter:
    """Adaptive rate limiter that adjusts based on system load"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_client: redis.Redis, config: RateLimitConfig):
        self.redis = redis_client
        self.config = config
        self.base_limiter = SlidingWindowRateLimiter(redis_client, config)
        self.load_history = deque(maxlen=60)  # Last 60 seconds of load data
        self.adjustment_factor = 1.0
        self.lock = Lock()
        
    def update_load(self, current_load: float):
        """Update system load metrics"""
        with self.lock:
            self.load_history.append((time.time(), current_load))
            
            # Calculate average load over last minute
            if len(self.load_history) >= 10:
                avg_load = np.mean([load for _, load in self.load_history])
                
                # Adjust rate limit based on load
                if avg_load > 0.9:  # System overloaded
                    self.adjustment_factor = 0.5
                elif avg_load > 0.8:
                    self.adjustment_factor = 0.7
                elif avg_load > 0.7:
                    self.adjustment_factor = 0.85
                else:
                    self.adjustment_factor = 1.0
    
    def check(self, user_id: str, endpoint: str, cost: int = 1) -> Tuple[bool, int]:
        """Check with adaptive rate limiting"""
        # Adjust limit based on current system load
        adjusted_config = RateLimitConfig(
            tier=self.config.tier,
            requests_per_hour=int(self.config.requests_per_hour * self.adjustment_factor),
            burst_size=int(self.config.burst_size * self.adjustment_factor),
            concurrent_requests=self.config.concurrent_requests,
            algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW
        )
        
        limiter = SlidingWindowRateLimiter(self.redis, adjusted_config)
        return limiter.check(user_id, endpoint, cost)


class RateLimitManager:
    """Main rate limiting manager"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_host: str = "localhost", redis_port: int = 6379):
        self.redis = redis.Redis(host=redis_host, port=redis_port, decode_responses=True)
        self.metrics = RateLimitMetrics()
        self.limiters: Dict[str, Any] = {}
        self.tier_configs = self._load_tier_configs()
        self.endpoint_costs = self._load_endpoint_costs()
        self._initialize_limiters()
        
    def _load_tier_configs(self) -> Dict[str, RateLimitConfig]:
        """Load tier configurations"""
        return {
            "basic": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="basic",
                requests_per_hour=100,
                burst_size=20,
                concurrent_requests=5,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW
            ),
            "pro": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="pro",
                requests_per_hour=1000,
                burst_size=100,
                concurrent_requests=20,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.TOKEN_BUCKET
            ),
            "enterprise": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="enterprise",
                requests_per_hour=10000,
                burst_size=500,
                concurrent_requests=100,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.ADAPTIVE
            ),
            "unlimited": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="unlimited",
                requests_per_hour=-1,  # Unlimited
                burst_size=-1,
                concurrent_requests=-1,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW
            )
        }
    
    def _load_endpoint_costs(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Load endpoint cost multipliers"""
        return {
            "/quantum/process": 10,
            "/enterprise/solve": 5,
            "/security/audit": 5,
            "/context/optimize": 2,
            "/knowledge/query": 1,
            "/workflow/automate": 3,
            "/analytics/metrics": 1,
            "/health": 0  # Free endpoint
        }
    
    def _initialize_limiters(self):
        """Initialize rate limiters for each tier"""
        for tier, config in self.tier_configs.items():
            if config.algorithm == RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW:
                self.limiters[tier] = SlidingWindowRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
            elif config.algorithm == RateLimitAlgorithm.TOKEN_BUCKET:
                self.limiters[tier] = TokenBucketRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
            elif config.algorithm == RateLimitAlgorithm.ADAPTIVE:
                self.limiters[tier] = AdaptiveRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
            else:
                self.limiters[tier] = SlidingWindowRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
    
    def check_rate_limit(self, user_id: str, tier: str, endpoint: str) -> RateLimitStatus:
        """Check if a request is allowed"""
        start_time = time.time()
        
        # Handle unlimited tier
        if tier == "unlimited":
            self.metrics.requests_total.labels(tier=tier, endpoint=endpoint, result="allowed").inc()
            return RateLimitStatus(
                allowed=True,
                limit=-1,
                remaining=-1,
                reset_at=datetime.max,
                retry_after=None,
                tier=tier,
                current_usage=0.0
            )
        
        # Get endpoint cost
        cost = self.endpoint_costs.get(endpoint, 1)
        
        # Free endpoints
        if cost == 0:
            self.metrics.requests_total.labels(tier=tier, endpoint=endpoint, result="allowed").inc()
            return RateLimitStatus(
                allowed=True,
                limit=self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour,
                remaining=self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour,
                reset_at=datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(hours=1),
                retry_after=None,
                tier=tier,
                current_usage=0.0
            )
        
        # Check rate limit
        limiter = self.limiters.get(tier)
        if not limiter:
            limiter = self.limiters["basic"]  # Fallback to basic tier
        
        allowed, remaining = limiter.check(user_id, endpoint, cost)
        
        # Calculate reset time
        reset_at = datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(hours=1)
        
        # Calculate retry after if rate limited
        retry_after = None
        if not allowed:
            retry_after = 3600 // self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour  # Simple retry calculation
            self.metrics.limit_exceeded.labels(tier=tier, endpoint=endpoint).inc()
        
        # Update metrics
        self.metrics.requests_total.labels(
            tier=tier, 
            endpoint=endpoint, 
            result="allowed" if allowed else "denied"
        ).inc()
        self.metrics.requests_remaining.labels(user_id=user_id, tier=tier).set(remaining)
        self.metrics.response_time.observe(time.time() - start_time)
        
        # Calculate current usage percentage
        limit = self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour
        current_usage = ((limit - remaining) / limit * 100) if limit > 0 else 0
        
        return RateLimitStatus(
            allowed=allowed,
            limit=limit,
            remaining=remaining,
            reset_at=reset_at,
            retry_after=retry_after,
            tier=tier,
            current_usage=current_usage
        )
    
    def get_user_usage(self, user_id: str, tier: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get detailed usage statistics for a user"""
        usage = {}
        
        # Collect usage data for all endpoints
        for endpoint in self.endpoint_costs.keys():
            key = f"sliding:{user_id}:{endpoint}"
            count = self.redis.zcard(key)
            usage[endpoint] = count
        
        # Calculate total usage
        total_usage = sum(usage.values())
        limit = self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour
        
        return {
            "user_id": user_id,
            "tier": tier,
            "total_usage": total_usage,
            "limit": limit,
            "remaining": max(0, limit - total_usage) if limit > 0 else -1,
            "usage_percentage": (total_usage / limit * 100) if limit > 0 else 0,
            "endpoint_breakdown": usage,
            "reset_at": (datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(hours=1)).isoformat()
        }
    
    def update_system_load(self, load: float):
        """Update system load for adaptive rate limiting"""
        for tier, limiter in self.limiters.items():
            if isinstance(limiter, AdaptiveRateLimiter):
                limiter.update_load(load)


class ConcurrencyLimiter:
    """Concurrent request limiter"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_client: redis.Redis):
        self.redis = redis_client
        self.semaphores: Dict[str, asyncio.Semaphore] = {}
        
    async def acquire(self, user_id: str, tier: str, limit: int) -> bool:
        """Acquire a concurrent request slot"""
        key = f"concurrent:{user_id}"
        
        # Use Redis to track concurrent requests across distributed system
        current = self.redis.incr(key)
        self.redis.expire(key, 60)  # Auto-cleanup after 1 minute
        
        if current > limit:
            self.redis.decr(key)  # Release if over limit
            return False
        
        return True
    
    async def release(self, user_id: str):
        """Release a concurrent request slot"""
        key = f"concurrent:{user_id}"
        self.redis.decr(key)


class CircuitBreaker:
    """Circuit breaker for protecting against cascading failures"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_client: redis.Redis, 
                 failure_threshold: int = 5,
                 recovery_timeout: int = 60):
        self.redis = redis_client
        self.failure_threshold = failure_threshold
        self.recovery_timeout = recovery_timeout
        
    def is_open(self, endpoint: str) -> bool:
        """Check if circuit breaker is open (blocking requests)"""
        key = f"circuit:{endpoint}"
        state = self.redis.get(key)
        return state == "open"
    
    def record_success(self, endpoint: str):
        """Record successful request"""
        key = f"circuit:{endpoint}:failures"
        self.redis.delete(key)
    
    def record_failure(self, endpoint: str):
        """Record failed request"""
        failure_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}:failures"
        circuit_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}"
        
        # Increment failure count
        failures = self.redis.incr(failure_key)
        self.redis.expire(failure_key, 60)
        
        # Open circuit if threshold exceeded
        if failures >= self.failure_threshold:
            self.redis.setex(circuit_key, self.recovery_timeout, "open")
            return True
        
        return False
    
    def get_status(self, endpoint: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get circuit breaker status"""
        circuit_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}"
        failure_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}:failures"
        
        state = self.redis.get(circuit_key)
        failures = int(self.redis.get(failure_key) or 0)
        
        return {
            "endpoint": endpoint,
            "state": state or "closed",
            "failures": failures,
            "threshold": self.failure_threshold,
            "recovery_timeout": self.recovery_timeout
        }


# Monitoring Dashboard Data Provider
class MonitoringDashboard:
    """Provides data for monitoring dashboard"""
    
    def __init__(self, rate_limit_manager: RateLimitManager):
        self.manager = rate_limit_manager
        
    def get_system_metrics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get overall system metrics"""
        # Collect metrics from Prometheus
        metrics = {
            "timestamp": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
            "total_requests": self._get_prometheus_metric("rate_limit_requests_total"),
            "rate_limited_requests": self._get_prometheus_metric("rate_limit_exceeded_total"),
            "average_check_time_ms": self._get_prometheus_metric("rate_limit_check_duration_seconds") * 1000,
            "tier_breakdown": self._get_tier_breakdown(),
            "endpoint_breakdown": self._get_endpoint_breakdown(),
            "system_health": self._calculate_system_health()
        }
        return metrics
    
    def _get_prometheus_metric(self, metric_name: str) -> float:
        """Get value from Prometheus metric"""
        # Simplified - in production, query Prometheus server
        return 0.0
    
    def _get_tier_breakdown(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Get request breakdown by tier"""
        return {
            "basic": 1000,
            "pro": 5000,
            "enterprise": 20000,
            "unlimited": 100
        }
    
    def _get_endpoint_breakdown(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Get request breakdown by endpoint"""
        return {
            "/quantum/process": 500,
            "/enterprise/solve": 1000,
            "/context/optimize": 5000,
            "/knowledge/query": 10000
        }
    
    def _calculate_system_health(self) -> str:
        """Calculate overall system health"""
        # Simplified health calculation
        return "healthy"


# Example usage and testing
if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Initialize rate limit manager
    manager = RateLimitManager()
    
    # Test rate limiting for different tiers
    test_cases = [
        ("user1", "basic", "/context/optimize"),
        ("user2", "pro", "/quantum/process"),
        ("user3", "enterprise", "/enterprise/solve"),
        ("user4", "unlimited", "/security/audit")
    ]
    
    print("Rate Limiting Test Results:")
    print("-" * 60)
    
    for user_id, tier, endpoint in test_cases:
        status = manager.check_rate_limit(user_id, tier, endpoint)
        print(f"User: {user_id} | Tier: {tier} | Endpoint: {endpoint}")
        print(f"  Allowed: {status.allowed}")
        print(f"  Remaining: {status.remaining}/{status.limit}")
        print(f"  Usage: {status.current_usage:.1f}%")
        print()
    
    # Get user usage statistics
    usage = manager.get_user_usage("user1", "basic")
    print("User Usage Statistics:")
    print(json.dumps(usage, indent=2))
    
    # Test circuit breaker
    circuit_breaker = CircuitBreaker(manager.redis)
    
    # Simulate failures
    for _ in range(6):
        circuit_breaker.record_failure("/failing/endpoint")
    
    print("\nCircuit Breaker Status:")
    print(json.dumps(circuit_breaker.get_status("/failing/endpoint"), indent=2))
    
    # Test monitoring dashboard
    dashboard = MonitoringDashboard(manager)
    metrics = dashboard.get_system_metrics()
    print("\nSystem Metrics:")
    print(json.dumps(metrics, indent=2, default=str))

                    self.adjustment_factor = 0.85
                else:
                    self.adjustment_factor = 1.0
    
    def check(self, user_id: str, endpoint: str, cost: int = 1) -> Tuple[bool, int]:
        """Check with adaptive rate limiting"""
        # Adjust limit based on current system load
        adjusted_config = RateLimitConfig(
            tier=self.config.tier,
            requests_per_hour=int(self.config.requests_per_hour * self.adjustment_factor),
            burst_size=int(self.config.burst_size * self.adjustment_factor),
            concurrent_requests=self.config.concurrent_requests,
            algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW
        )
        
        limiter = SlidingWindowRateLimiter(self.redis, adjusted_config)
        return limiter.check(user_id, endpoint, cost)


class RateLimitManager:
    """Main rate limiting manager"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_host: str = "localhost", redis_port: int = 6379):
        self.redis = redis.Redis(host=redis_host, port=redis_port, decode_responses=True)
        self.metrics = RateLimitMetrics()
        self.limiters: Dict[str, Any] = {}
        self.tier_configs = self._load_tier_configs()
        self.endpoint_costs = self._load_endpoint_costs()
        self._initialize_limiters()
        
    def _load_tier_configs(self) -> Dict[str, RateLimitConfig]:
        """Load tier configurations"""
        return {
            "basic": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="basic",
                requests_per_hour=100,
                burst_size=20,
                concurrent_requests=5,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW
            ),
            "pro": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="pro",
                requests_per_hour=1000,
                burst_size=100,
                concurrent_requests=20,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.TOKEN_BUCKET
            ),
            "enterprise": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="enterprise",
                requests_per_hour=10000,
                burst_size=500,
                concurrent_requests=100,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.ADAPTIVE
            ),
            "unlimited": RateLimitConfig(
                tier="unlimited",
                requests_per_hour=-1,  # Unlimited
                burst_size=-1,
                concurrent_requests=-1,
                algorithm=RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW
            )
        }
    
    def _load_endpoint_costs(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Load endpoint cost multipliers"""
        return {
            "/quantum/process": 10,
            "/enterprise/solve": 5,
            "/security/audit": 5,
            "/context/optimize": 2,
            "/knowledge/query": 1,
            "/workflow/automate": 3,
            "/analytics/metrics": 1,
            "/health": 0  # Free endpoint
        }
    
    def _initialize_limiters(self):
        """Initialize rate limiters for each tier"""
        for tier, config in self.tier_configs.items():
            if config.algorithm == RateLimitAlgorithm.SLIDING_WINDOW:
                self.limiters[tier] = SlidingWindowRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
            elif config.algorithm == RateLimitAlgorithm.TOKEN_BUCKET:
                self.limiters[tier] = TokenBucketRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
            elif config.algorithm == RateLimitAlgorithm.ADAPTIVE:
                self.limiters[tier] = AdaptiveRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
            else:
                self.limiters[tier] = SlidingWindowRateLimiter(self.redis, config)
    
    def check_rate_limit(self, user_id: str, tier: str, endpoint: str) -> RateLimitStatus:
        """Check if a request is allowed"""
        start_time = time.time()
        
        # Handle unlimited tier
        if tier == "unlimited":
            self.metrics.requests_total.labels(tier=tier, endpoint=endpoint, result="allowed").inc()
            return RateLimitStatus(
                allowed=True,
                limit=-1,
                remaining=-1,
                reset_at=datetime.max,
                retry_after=None,
                tier=tier,
                current_usage=0.0
            )
        
        # Get endpoint cost
        cost = self.endpoint_costs.get(endpoint, 1)
        
        # Free endpoints
        if cost == 0:
            self.metrics.requests_total.labels(tier=tier, endpoint=endpoint, result="allowed").inc()
            return RateLimitStatus(
                allowed=True,
                limit=self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour,
                remaining=self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour,
                reset_at=datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(hours=1),
                retry_after=None,
                tier=tier,
                current_usage=0.0
            )
        
        # Check rate limit
        limiter = self.limiters.get(tier)
        if not limiter:
            limiter = self.limiters["basic"]  # Fallback to basic tier
        
        allowed, remaining = limiter.check(user_id, endpoint, cost)
        
        # Calculate reset time
        reset_at = datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(hours=1)
        
        # Calculate retry after if rate limited
        retry_after = None
        if not allowed:
            retry_after = 3600 // self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour  # Simple retry calculation
            self.metrics.limit_exceeded.labels(tier=tier, endpoint=endpoint).inc()
        
        # Update metrics
        self.metrics.requests_total.labels(
            tier=tier, 
            endpoint=endpoint, 
            result="allowed" if allowed else "denied"
        ).inc()
        self.metrics.requests_remaining.labels(user_id=user_id, tier=tier).set(remaining)
        self.metrics.response_time.observe(time.time() - start_time)
        
        # Calculate current usage percentage
        limit = self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour
        current_usage = ((limit - remaining) / limit * 100) if limit > 0 else 0
        
        return RateLimitStatus(
            allowed=allowed,
            limit=limit,
            remaining=remaining,
            reset_at=reset_at,
            retry_after=retry_after,
            tier=tier,
            current_usage=current_usage
        )
    
    def get_user_usage(self, user_id: str, tier: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get detailed usage statistics for a user"""
        usage = {}
        
        # Collect usage data for all endpoints
        for endpoint in self.endpoint_costs.keys():
            key = f"sliding:{user_id}:{endpoint}"
            count = self.redis.zcard(key)
            usage[endpoint] = count
        
        # Calculate total usage
        total_usage = sum(usage.values())
        limit = self.tier_configs[tier].requests_per_hour
        
        return {
            "user_id": user_id,
            "tier": tier,
            "total_usage": total_usage,
            "limit": limit,
            "remaining": max(0, limit - total_usage) if limit > 0 else -1,
            "usage_percentage": (total_usage / limit * 100) if limit > 0 else 0,
            "endpoint_breakdown": usage,
            "reset_at": (datetime.utcnow() + timedelta(hours=1)).isoformat()
        }
    
    def update_system_load(self, load: float):
        """Update system load for adaptive rate limiting"""
        for tier, limiter in self.limiters.items():
            if isinstance(limiter, AdaptiveRateLimiter):
                limiter.update_load(load)


class ConcurrencyLimiter:
    """Concurrent request limiter"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_client: redis.Redis):
        self.redis = redis_client
        self.semaphores: Dict[str, asyncio.Semaphore] = {}
        
    async def acquire(self, user_id: str, tier: str, limit: int) -> bool:
        """Acquire a concurrent request slot"""
        key = f"concurrent:{user_id}"
        
        # Use Redis to track concurrent requests across distributed system
        current = self.redis.incr(key)
        self.redis.expire(key, 60)  # Auto-cleanup after 1 minute
        
        if current > limit:
            self.redis.decr(key)  # Release if over limit
            return False
        
        return True
    
    async def release(self, user_id: str):
        """Release a concurrent request slot"""
        key = f"concurrent:{user_id}"
        self.redis.decr(key)


class CircuitBreaker:
    """Circuit breaker for protecting against cascading failures"""
    
    def __init__(self, redis_client: redis.Redis, 
                 failure_threshold: int = 5,
                 recovery_timeout: int = 60):
        self.redis = redis_client
        self.failure_threshold = failure_threshold
        self.recovery_timeout = recovery_timeout
        
    def is_open(self, endpoint: str) -> bool:
        """Check if circuit breaker is open (blocking requests)"""
        key = f"circuit:{endpoint}"
        state = self.redis.get(key)
        return state == "open"
    
    def record_success(self, endpoint: str):
        """Record successful request"""
        key = f"circuit:{endpoint}:failures"
        self.redis.delete(key)
    
    def record_failure(self, endpoint: str):
        """Record failed request"""
        failure_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}:failures"
        circuit_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}"
        
        # Increment failure count
        failures = self.redis.incr(failure_key)
        self.redis.expire(failure_key, 60)
        
        # Open circuit if threshold exceeded
        if failures >= self.failure_threshold:
            self.redis.setex(circuit_key, self.recovery_timeout, "open")
            return True
        
        return False
    
    def get_status(self, endpoint: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get circuit breaker status"""
        circuit_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}"
        failure_key = f"circuit:{endpoint}:failures"
        
        state = self.redis.get(circuit_key)
        failures = int(self.redis.get(failure_key) or 0)
        
        return {
            "endpoint": endpoint,
            "state": state or "closed",
            "failures": failures,
            "threshold": self.failure_threshold,
            "recovery_timeout": self.recovery_timeout
        }


# Monitoring Dashboard Data Provider
class MonitoringDashboard:
    """Provides data for monitoring dashboard"""
    
    def __init__(self, rate_limit_manager: RateLimitManager):
        self.manager = rate_limit_manager
        
    def get_system_metrics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get overall system metrics"""
        # Collect metrics from Prometheus
        metrics = {
            "timestamp": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
            "total_requests": self._get_prometheus_metric("rate_limit_requests_total"),
            "rate_limited_requests": self._get_prometheus_metric("rate_limit_exceeded_total"),
            "average_check_time_ms": self._get_prometheus_metric("rate_limit_check_duration_seconds") * 1000,
            "tier_breakdown": self._get_tier_breakdown(),
            "endpoint_breakdown": self._get_endpoint_breakdown(),
            "system_health": self._calculate_system_health()
        }
        return metrics
    
    def _get_prometheus_metric(self, metric_name: str) -> float:
        """Get value from Prometheus metric"""
        # Simplified - in production, query Prometheus server
        return 0.0
    
    def _get_tier_breakdown(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Get request breakdown by tier"""
        return {
            "basic": 1000,
            "pro": 5000,
            "enterprise": 20000,
            "unlimited": 100
        }
    
    def _get_endpoint_breakdown(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Get request breakdown by endpoint"""
        return {
            "/quantum/process": 500,
            "/enterprise/solve": 1000,
            "/context/optimize": 5000,
            "/knowledge/query": 10000
        }
    
    def _calculate_system_health(self) -> str:
        """Calculate overall system health"""
        # Simplified health calculation
        return "healthy"


# Example usage and testing
if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Initialize rate limit manager
    manager = RateLimitManager()
    
    # Test rate limiting for different tiers
    test_cases = [
        ("user1", "basic", "/context/optimize"),
        ("user2", "pro", "/quantum/process"),
        ("user3", "enterprise", "/enterprise/solve"),
        ("user4", "unlimited", "/security/audit")
    ]
    
    print("Rate Limiting Test Results:")
    print("-" * 60)
    
    for user_id, tier, endpoint in test_cases:
        status = manager.check_rate_limit(user_id, tier, endpoint)
        print(f"User: {user_id} | Tier: {tier} | Endpoint: {endpoint}")
        print(f"  Allowed: {status.allowed}")
        print(f"  Remaining: {status.remaining}/{status.limit}")
        print(f"  Usage: {status.current_usage:.1f}%")
        print()
    
    # Get user usage statistics
    usage = manager.get_user_usage("user1", "basic")
    print("User Usage Statistics:")
    print(json.dumps(usage, indent=2))
    
    # Test circuit breaker
    circuit_breaker = CircuitBreaker(manager.redis)
    
    # Simulate failures
    for _ in range(6):
        circuit_breaker.record_failure("/failing/endpoint")
    
    print("\nCircuit Breaker Status:")
    print(json.dumps(circuit_breaker.get_status("/failing/endpoint"), indent=2))
    
    # Test monitoring dashboard
    dashboard = MonitoringDashboard(manager)
    metrics = dashboard.get_system_metrics()
    print("\nSystem Metrics:")
    print(json.dumps(metrics, indent=2, default=str))
